content: I'm trying to install the oh-my-opencode plugin into opencode. It's not working but I don't know why. Help me debug it

tool_input.description: Check if OpenCode is installed and get the version
Check if OpenCode is installed and get the version

tool_output.description: Check if OpenCode is installed and get the version

tool_input.description: Check if oh-my-opencode is installed globally via npm
Check if oh-my-opencode is installed globally via npm

tool_output.description: Check if oh-my-opencode is installed globally via npm

tool_input.description: Install the oh-my-opencode plugin globally
Install the oh-my-opencode plugin globally

Commands:
  opencode acp                 start ACP (Agent Client Protocol) server
  opencode [project]           start opencode tui                                          [default]
  opencode attach <url>        attach to a running opencode server
  opencode run [message..]     run opencode with a message
  opencode auth                manage credentials
  opencode agent               manage agents
  opencode upgrade [target]    upgrade opencode to the latest or a specific version
  opencode uninstall           uninstall opencode and remove all related files
  opencode serve               starts a headless opencode server
  opencode web                 starts a headless opencode server
  opencode models [provider]   list all available models
  opencode stats               show token usage and cost statistics
  opencode export [sessionID]  export session data as JSON
tool_output.description: Check if OpenCode loads without plugin errors

tool_input.command: cd /tmp/test-opencode && echo 'test' > test.txt && timeout 10 opencode "list files in this directory" 2>&1 | grep -i error || echo "No errors found"

opencode auth

manage credentials

Commands:
  opencode auth login [url]  log in to a provider
  opencode auth logout       log out from a configured provider
  opencode auth list         list providers                                            [aliases: ls]

Options:
  -h, --help        show help                                                              [boolean]
  -v, --version     show version number                                                    [boolean]
      --print-logs  print logs to stderr                                                   [boolean]
      --log-level   log level                   [string] [choices: "DEBUG", "INFO", "WARN", "ERROR"]
